intro: Erophila boerhaavii var. muricola, commonly known as the rough erophila, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, raised bumps, giving it a textured appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands or along riverbanks. This variant is distinguished by its rough, serrated leaf margins and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
